address: Xã Chư Ngọc, Huyện Krông Pa, Tỉnh Gia Lai
thought:
**Identifying the New Administrative Unit for "Xã Chư Ngọc"**

Okay, here's my thought process on this. The user has provided an old address: "Xã Chư Ngọc, Huyện Krông Pa, Tỉnh Gia Lai", and they want the new ward. My first step is to confirm if there have been any province mergers. Checking my resources, specifically against the relevant documentation on administrative changes, I see that while there was a proposed merger of Gia Lai and Bình Định, the name remains "Tỉnh Gia Lai." So, that's straightforward.

Next, I need to focus on ward-level changes. I immediately jump to the "Other resolutions" to see if there's anything about "Xã Chư Ngọc." Bingo! In "1664/NQ-UBTVQH15," it's explicitly stated that "Xã Chư Ngọc" was merged into a new ward called "**xã Phú Túc**." That's a direct mapping, which is excellent.

Now, I look up "xã Phú Túc" in the "New wards" list, specifically within "Tỉnh Gia Lai." There it is: `{"ward_code":"24076","ward_name":"Xã Phú Túc","province_name":"Tỉnh Gia Lai"}`.

Finally, I'll compile the output. This is a very high-confidence scenario. The citation will include the relevant header and line from the resolution. I'll note the province name is still "Tỉnh Gia Lai." The ward code and name are from the "New wards" data. It's a clean, direct mapping.

citation.header: 1664/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Gia Lai
citation.line: 82. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của thị trấn Phú Túc và các xã Phú Cần, Chư Ngọc, Ia Mlah, Đất Bằng thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Phú Túc.
